overall_perception_summary.headline: The Clinical Pragmatist
overall_perception_summary.description: Aquaphor is the ultimate utility player in the skincare world. It rejects all vanity and trendiness to occupy the position of the Medical Authority, offering a sterile, highly effective tool for urgent repair. It feels like a prescription you can buy without a doctor, solving skin crises with zero emotional fluff but absolute reliability.

foundation.title: The Medical Authority
foundation.description: The brand derives its power entirely from the Clinic, citing '#1 Dermatologist Recommended' as its primary credential. Its purpose is purely Restorative—fixing broken, cracked skin rather than enhancing beauty. Positioned as a Daily Essential at a commodity price, it sacrifices all aesthetic 'shelfie' appeal for the visual codes of the pharmacy.

identity.title: The Sterile Caregiver
identity.description: The brand maintains a Distant but Helpful dynamic, acting like a competent nurse rather than a friend. Dominated by The Caregiver (60%) and The Sage (25%) archetypes, it uses a Pharma-Code visual identity (sterile white and blue) to signal safety. The tone is The Clinical Authority—dry, factual, and devoid of humor.

communication.title: Problem-Solving Science
communication.description: The messaging leads with the Benefit ('Relief') backed by Rational persuasion ('Clinically proven'). The USP is the Form Factor—taking a trusted formula and making it 'mess-free' for on-the-go utility. The narrative is a Lab Breakthrough story, focusing on the mechanism of the 'semi-occlusive' barrier rather than a founder's journey.

benefits.title: Urgent Restoration
benefits.description: Functionally, it is a Fixer, repairing the skin barrier to stop pain. The emotional payoff is Relief—the absence of discomfort and the return to normalcy. It allows the user to signal Pragmatism, proving they prioritize what works over marketing hype, and places them firmly in The Safe Choice majority.

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.reasoning: The authority is strictly medical, anchored by the '#1 Dermatologist Recommended' claim and 'Skin Protectant' drug facts classification (Origin: 1/5 Pure Clinical). The goal is not to make skin pretty, but to fix a pathology—specifically 'dry, cracked, irritated skin' and 'minor cuts and scrapes' (Mission: 1/5 Pathology Cure). Clinical source + fixing goal = The Healer.
marker_1.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Skin Protectant... Relieves dry, cracked, irritated skin... minor cuts and scrapes

marker_2.reasoning: The mission scope is hyper-focused on micro-correction: 'spot treatment', 'on-the-go', 'drool rash', 'heels'. It solves small, specific problems (Scope: 1/5 Micro-Correction). With mass retail distribution and accessible pricing, it is available to everyone (Access: 5/5 Democratic). Specific fix + universal access = The Democratizers of skin repair.
marker_2.evidence: On-the-go... spot treatment... dry heels... drool rash... friction and windburn

marker_3.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Spec Sheet (Exact percentages, pH, sourcing)
marker_3.reasoning: The brand prioritizes tolerance above all else. 'Hypoallergenic', 'Fragrance-free', 'Paraben-free', 'Suitable for sensitive skin' are the non-negotiables (Performance: 1/5 Hypoallergenic). They reveal the active ingredient percentage 'Petrolatum (30%)' directly on the front label, treating the user like a clinician (Transparency: 1/5 The Spec Sheet). Absolute safety + technical transparency = Safety First.
marker_3.evidence: Hypoallergenic... Fragrance-free... Paraben-free... Suitable for sensitive skin... Petrolatum (30%)

marker_4.reasoning: The aesthetic is stark white and medical blue with zero lifestyle fluff—it looks like it belongs in a first aid kit, not a vanity (Aesthetic: 1/5 Clinical Sterile). The product is a utility staple, a 'multipurpose' tool for the whole family, priced for everyday use (Value: 2/5 Daily Essential). Sterile look + utility function = The Medical Authority.
marker_4.evidence: White packaging... Blue clinical typography... Multipurpose... For babies and adults

marker_5.reasoning: The emotional temperature is professional and distant—'Clinically proven', 'Skin Protectant' are facts, not feelings (Thermostat: 2/5 Distant). The stance is authoritative, leaning on the '#1 Dermatologist Recommended' credential to lead the conversation (Power Dynamic: 4/5 Specialist). Professional distance + expert authority = The Reliable Expert.
marker_5.evidence: Clinically proven... Skin Protectant... #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Essential solution

marker_6.reasoning: The brand's primary drive is to protect and heal ('Healing Balm', 'Protectant'), fitting The Caregiver (60%). The reliance on dermatology and clinical proof adds a strong layer of The Sage (25%). The accessibility and 'multipurpose' nature for the whole family brings in The Everyman (15%). Caregiver + Sage = The Stabilizers, offering certainty and protection in a chaotic world.
marker_6.evidence: Healing Balm... Protectant... Dermatologist Recommended... Clinically proven... For the whole family

marker_7.reasoning: There is absolutely zero humor; the tone is purely functional (Humor: 1/5 Grave). The language uses medical terminology like 'semi-occlusive', 'petrolatum', and 'chapped' (Formality: 1/5 Academic). The energy is flat and factual (Enthusiasm: 1/5 Clinical). This is the voice of a diagnosis.
marker_7.evidence: Semi-occlusive... Petrolatum (30%)... Skin Protectant... Chapped, cracked skin... Minor cuts

marker_8.reasoning: The visual world is stark white and clinical blue, evoking a hospital environment (Thermostat: 1/5 Sterile). The layout is rigid, information-heavy, and structured like a medical chart or drug facts label (Entropy: 1/5 Swiss Grid). Cold temperature + rigid control = Pharma-Code.
marker_8.evidence: Stark white background... Clinical blue logo... Drug Facts table... Minimalist stick packaging
marker_8.look_and_feel: Pure medical utility; the aesthetic of a sterile bandage or a prescription box.
marker_8.primary_palette: Clinical white dominated by deep medical blue, with functional red accents for urgency.

marker_9.reasoning: The messaging leads with the result: 'Healing', 'Relief', 'Protection' (Hook: 4/5 Result). The persuasion is purely logical and data-backed—'Clinically proven', '30% Petrolatum', '#1 Recommended' (Persuasion: 1/5 Raw Data). Result-focus + logical argument = The Problem Solver.
marker_9.evidence: Clinically proven to restore... Relief for dry skin... Skin Protectant... #1 Recommended

marker_10.reasoning: The story isn't about a person; it's about 'Dermatologists' and 'Clinical efficacy'. The hero is the faceless expert (Protagonist: 1/5 The Nobel). The setting is implied to be a clinic or a lab where formulas are tested (Setting: 1/5 Sterile). Expert hero + clinical setting = The Lab Breakthrough.
marker_10.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Clinically proven... formulated for sensitive skin

marker_11.reasoning: The primary validation is the 'Dermatologist Recommended' badge, which is the gold standard of authority (Validator: 1/5 The Board). The proof is 'Clinically proven' status and the 'Drug Facts' panel, which represents truth through regulation and studies (Proof: 1/5 The Graph). Board validation + clinical proof = Derm-Validation.
marker_11.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Clinically proven... Drug Facts... Active Ingredient: Petrolatum

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP OBJECT (What You Claim to Own)
marker_12.slider_b_label: [SLIDER] THE TARGET SCOPE (How Wide Is The Net?)
marker_12.reasoning: The ingredient 'Petrolatum' is a generic commodity, though the brand equity raises it slightly (Ownership: 1/5 Commodity). However, the scope is defined by specific problems: 'Dry heels', 'Chapped lips', 'Drool rash', 'Friction' (Scope: 4/5 The Problem). Focusing on specific problems with a trusted commodity = The Specialist.
marker_12.evidence: Dry heels... Chapped lips... Drool rash... Friction... Minor cuts... Scrapes

marker_13.reasoning: The content explains the mechanism—how the stick format works for specific areas, the 'semi-occlusive' nature (Depth: 2/5 Explainer). The goal is to build trust through this explanation and the 'Dermatologist' credentials, rather than just closing a sale with vibes (Intent: 1/5 The Thesis). Explanation + Trust goal = Science Education.
marker_13.evidence: Semi-occlusive... allows oxygen to flow... creates a protective barrier... mess-free application

marker_14.reasoning: The action is undeniably healing and repairing damaged skin barriers, not just maintaining them (Action: 4/5 The Healer). The outcome is biological health—restoring the skin's integrity—rather than visual perfection or 'glow' (Outcome: 1/5 Biological). Repair mechanism + biological goal = Restoration.
marker_14.evidence: Repairing Ointment... Healing Balm... Restores smooth, healthy skin... Protects... Relieves

marker_15.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Panic Mode (Urgent need to stop pain/itch)
marker_15.reasoning: This product is for when things are going wrong—chafing, cracking, bleeding. It addresses an urgent need for relief (Anxiety: 1/5 Panic Mode). The payoff is simply feeling normal and comfortable again, not superior or savvy (Self-Perception: 2/5 Comfort). Urgent relief + return to baseline = Relief / Safety.
marker_15.evidence: Relief for dry, cracked skin... Soothes irritation... Protects minor cuts... Chapped

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Tool (I buy it only because it functions)
marker_16.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Standard (What everyone uses; the default)
marker_16.reasoning: You buy Aquaphor because it works, period. It is a tool, not a lifestyle statement (Signal: 1/5 The Tool). It is the standard choice for everyone from babies to athletes, signaling no specific tribe other than 'people with skin' (Tribal: 1/5 The Standard). Pure function + universal standard = The Pragmatist.
marker_16.evidence: Multipurpose... For the whole family... Essential solution... Convenient size

marker_17.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Acceptance (I want to be accepted by the group)
marker_17.reasoning: Using Aquaphor signals that you are making the safe, approved choice. It offers the comfort of assimilation—'Dermatologists recommend it, everyone uses it' (Social Vector: 2/5 Acceptance). It places you in the massive majority of pragmatists (Group Dynamic: 1/5 The Majority). Safety + Majority = The Safe Choice.
marker_17.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Loved by many... Trusted brand... Essential
